intro: Baphia dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of many legumes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
